Structure of the content to be analyzed.

object.ReferenceEquals(object, object)

Examples

Context: "They are discussing the latest Indiana Jones movie."

Message: "You are an idiot, and your opinion is worthless. The old movies were better, you jerk!"

Possible result: "Your opinion is valuable, but I personally prefer the older Indiana Jones movies."

Possible result with no context: "Your opinion is valid, but the old film productions were more preferred."

Remarks

The use of Context aids in providing a subject-oriented response suggestion. If omitted, the result will be disconnected from the subject, although the result will still make sense.

Constructors

ContentAnalyse(string, string?)

Structure of the content to be analyzed.

public ContentAnalyse(string Message, string? Context)

Parameters

Message string

The message to be analyzed.

Context string

The subject that should be taken into consideration during the response generation.

Examples

Context: "They are discussing the latest Indiana Jones movie."

Message: "You are an idiot, and your opinion is worthless. The old movies were better, you jerk!"

Possible result: "Your opinion is valuable, but I personally prefer the older Indiana Jones movies."

Possible result with no context: "Your opinion is valid, but the old film productions were more preferred."

Remarks

The use of Context aids in providing a subject-oriented response suggestion. If omitted, the result will be disconnected from the subject, although the result will still make sense.
